poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: This might have been my favourite port for waiting out monsoons In lamplight, behind bead curtains But holiness cut a strath through local life: Women took cover and men to the pulpit. The singer who mocked their pat exegesis Of mudslid muezzins and rubbled kirks - Well you know what happened to him. Five centuries on, some archive explorer Will crack a wry smile.
